SENT.plain: We present a 74-year-old woman with a recent diagnosis of myelodysplastic syndrome who presented with left upper quadrant abdominal pain and fatigue with significant splenomegaly, anemia, and thrombocytopenia
She underwent splenectomy and bone marrow biopsy
Pathology of both spleen and bone marrow revealed an unusual diagnosis
A review of the differential diagnosis, laboratory tests, nature of the underlying disease, and treatment are provided
